breakdown.cost_breakdown_aria_label: A description of markup, raw cost and usage cost

cost_chart.aria_desc: Breakdown of markup, raw, and usage costs

historical_chart.cpu_title: CPU usage, request, and limit comparison
historical_chart.memory_title: Memory usage, request, and limit comparison

breakdown.markup_desc: The portion of cost calculated by applying markup or discount to infrastructure raw cost in the cost management application.
breakdown.raw_cost_desc: The costs reported by a cloud provider without any cost model calculations applied.
breakdown.title: {{value}}
breakdown.usage_cost_desc: The portion of cost calculated by applying hourly and/or monthly price list rates to metrics.

add_rate_form.duplicate: This tag key is already in used
add_rate_form.error_message: Rate should be a positive number
add_rate_form.not_positive: Rate must be a positive number

cost_models.infra_cost_switch: Use this rate to calculate infrastructure cost

cost_models_details.assign_sources_error_desc: You cannot assign a source at this time. Try refreshing this page. If the problem persists, contact your organization administrator or visit our <0>Status Page</0> for known outages.
cost_models_details.description_distribution: The following is the type of metric that is set to be used when distributing costs to the project level breakdowns.
cost_models_details.description_distribution_model: This choice is for users to direct how their raw costs are distributed either by CPU or Memory on the project level breakdowns.
cost_models_details.description_markup: This Percentage is applied to raw cost calculations by multiplying the cost with this percentage. Costs calculated from price list rates will not be effected.
cost_models_details.description_markup_or_discount_model: Use markup/discount to manipulate how the raw costs are being calculated for your sources

empty_state_bad_uuid.description: Cost model with uuid: {{ uuid }} does not exist.
empty_state_bad_uuid.title: Cost model can not be found

empty_state_rate.description: To add rates to the price list, click on the "Add" rate button above.
empty_state_rate.title: No rates are set

empty_state_source.description: Select the source(s) you want to apply this cost model to.
empty_state_source.title: No sources are assigned

examples.title: Examples:
examples.noAdjustment: A markup or discount rate of (+/-) 0% (the default) makes no adjustments to the base costs of your source(s).
examples.doubleMarkup: A markup rate of (+) 100% doubles the base costs of your source(s).
examples.reduceBaseToZero: A discount rate of (-) 100% reduces the base costs of your source(s) to 0.
examples.reduceBaseToSeventyFive: A discount rate of (-) 25% reduces the base costs of your source(s) to 75% of the original value.

cost_models_router.no_match: This source is not assigned to any cost model
cost_models_router.server_error: Server error: could not get the cost model.

confirm.message: Are you sure you want to stop creating a cost model? All settings will be discarded.
confirm.title: Exit cost model creation

cost_models_wizard.description: A cost model allows you to associate a price to metrics provided by your sources to charge for utilization of resources.

empty_state.desc_create: To create a price list, begin by clicking the <0>Create rate</0> button.
empty_state.desc_other_time: You can create a price list or modify one at a later time.
empty_state.desc_skip: To skip this step, click the <0>next</0> button.
empty_state.title: A price list has not been created.

cost_models_wizard.inprogress_message: Please wait while processing the request

markup.invalid_markup_text: Markup must be a positive or negative number
markup.sub_title: To apply a markup to the base cost of your source(s), enter a positive percentage value. To apply a discount, enter a negative value to subtract from the base costs.
markup.title: Set a markup or discount (optional)

cost_models_wizard.no_rates: No rates were added to the price list

price_list.data_list_aria_label: Cost model price list data list
price_list.sub_title_add: Select the metric you want to assign a price to, and specify a measurement unit and rate. You can optionally set multiple rates for particular tags.
price_list.sub_title_table: The following is a list of rates you have set so far for this price list.
price_list.title: Create a price list

review.sub_title_details: Review and confirm your cost model configuration and assignments. Click <0>Create</0> to create the cost model, or <1>Back</1> to revise.
review.sub_title_success: Costs for resources connected to the assigned sources will now be calculated using the newly created {{ cost_model }} cost model.

source.caption: Select from the following {{ type }} sources:

error.desc: Try refreshing this step or you can skip this step (as it is optional) and assign the source to the cost model at a later time. If the problem persists, contact your organization administrator or visit our <0>Status Page</0> for known outages.
error.title: This step is temporarily unavailable

source.sub_title: Select one or more sources to this cost model. You can skip this step and assign the cost model to a source at a later time. A source will be unavailable for selection if a cost model is already assigned to it.
source.title: Assign sources to the cost model (optional)

source_table.already_assigned: Cannot assigned a source that has already a cost model assigned to it

steps.sources: Assign a source to the cost model

cost_models_wizard.title: Create a cost model

cost_models_wizard.warning_sources: Cannot assign cost model to a source that is already assigned to another one

dashboard.total_cost_tooltip: This total cost is the sum of the infrastructure cost {{infrastructureCost}} and supplementary cost {{supplementaryCost}}

column_management.desc: Selected categories will be displayed in the table
column_management.title: Manage columns

details.empty_state: Processing data to generate a list of all services that sums to a total cost...

dialog.delete_cost_model_body_green: This action will delete {{ cost_model }} cost model from the system. This action cannot be undone.
dialog.delete_cost_model_body_red: You must unassign any sources before you can delete this cost model.
dialog.delete_cost_model_body_red_costmodel_del: The following sources are assigned to my production cost model:
dialog.delete_source_from_cost_model_body: This will remove the assignment of {{ source }} from the {{ cost_model }} cost model. You can then assign the cost model to a new source.

markup.body: This action will delete the markup from the {{ cost_model }} cost model. Any calculations that can be made with this markup rate will no longer be available.
markup.title: Delete markup from {{ cost_model }} cost model?

loading_state.sources_desc: Searching for your sources. Do not refresh the browser

maintenance.empty_state_desc: $t(cost_management) is currently undergoing scheduled maintenance and will be unavailable from 13:00 - 19:00 UTC (09:00 AM - 03:00 PM EDT).
maintenance.empty_state_thanks: We will be back soon. Thank you for your patience!.

no_data_state.desc: We have detected a source, but we are not done processing the incoming data. The time to process could take up to 24 hours. Try refreshing the page at a later time.
no_data_state.title: Still processing the data

no_match_found_state.desc: Sorry, no source with the given filter was found.
no_match_found_state.title: No match found

no_providers_state.aws_desc: Add an Amazon Web Services account to see a total cost breakdown of your spend by accounts, organizational units, services, regions, or tags.
no_providers_state.aws_title: Track your Amazon Web Services spending!
no_providers_state.azure_desc: Add a Microsoft Azure account to see a total cost breakdown of your spend by accounts, services, regions, or tags.
no_providers_state.gcp_desc: Add a Google Cloud Platform account to see a total cost breakdown of your spend by accounts, services, regions, or tags.
no_providers_state.gcp_title: Track your Google Cloud Platform spending!
no_providers_state.ibm_desc: Add an IBM Cloud account to see a total cost breakdown of your spend by accounts, services, regions, or tags.
no_providers_state.ocp_desc: Add an OpenShift Container Platform cluster to see a total cost breakdown of your pods by cluster, node, project, or labels.
no_providers_state.overview_desc: Add a source, like an OpenShift Container Platform cluster or a cloud services account, to see a total cost breakdown as well as usage information like instance counts and storage.

ocp_details.infrastructure_cost_desc: The cost based on raw usage data from the underlying infrastructure.
ocp_details.supplementary_aria_label: A description of infrastructure and supplementary cost
ocp_details.supplementary_cost_desc: All costs not directly attributed to the infrastructure. These costs are determined by applying a price list within a cost model to OpenShift cluster metrics.
ocp_details.title: OpenShift details

overview.aws_desc: Raw cost from Amazon Web Services infrastructure.
overview.gcp_desc: Raw cost from Google Cloud Platform infrastructure.
overview.ibm_desc: Raw cost from IBM Cloud infrastructure.
overview.ocp_cloud_desc: Infrastructure cost attributed to OpenShift Container Platform, based on a subset of cloud cost data.
overview.ocp_desc: Total cost for OpenShift Container Platform, comprising the infrastructure cost and cost calculated from metrics.

page_cost_models.header_popover: A cost model allows you to associate a price to metrics provided by your sources to charge for utilization of resources. <0>Learn more</0>
page_cost_models.no_cost_models_description: Create a cost model to start calculating your hybrid cloud costs using custom price lists, markups, or both. Click on the button below to begin the journey.

page_cost_models.no_cost_models_title: What is your hybrid cloud costing you?
